segments.en: Hello, everyone.
segments.cn: 大家好。

segments.en: Welcome back to EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 欢迎回到EnglishPod。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
segments.cn: 我叫Marco。

segments.en: And my name is Catherine.
segments.cn: 我叫Catherine。

segments.en: Welcome back, everyone.
segments.cn: 大家欢迎回来。

segments.en: So what are we talking about today, Marco?
segments.cn: 那么，Marco，今天我们要谈什么？

segments.en: We are going to the flower shop.
segments.cn: 我们要去花店。

segments.en: Okay, so this is an intermediate level lesson.
segments.cn: 好的，这是一节中级课程。

segments.en: And we're going to be learning about the different kinds of flowers you can buy at a flower shop.
segments.cn: 我们将学习在花店可以买到的不同种类的花。

segments.en: And so we've got a guy here who's probably trying to say something to someone he loves.
segments.cn: 这里有一个家伙，可能想对他爱的人说些什么。

segments.en: Yeah, I think he did something to his girlfriend or wife.
segments.cn: 是的，我觉得他对他的女朋友或妻子做了什么。

segments.en: And, well, that's the typical thing, right?
segments.cn: 这就是典型的情况，对吧？

segments.en: You do something wrong, so you've got to get her flowers.
segments.cn: 你做错了事，所以你得给她买花。

segments.en: And that's why women are often very nervous when their husband or boyfriend gives them flowers, because she's thinking, hmm, what did he do wrong?
segments.cn: 这就是为什么当女人的丈夫或男朋友给她们花时，往往会很紧张，因为她在想，嗯，他做错了什么？

segments.en: All right, so let's listen to the dialogue and we'll be back soon.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们听听对话，稍后再回来。

segments.en: Hello, sir.
segments.cn: 你好，先生。

segments.en: How may I help you?
segments.cn: 我能帮您什么？

segments.en: I would like to buy some flowers, please.
segments.cn: 我想买一些花。

segments.en: Something really nice.
segments.cn: 一些非常好的花。

segments.en: I see.
segments.cn: 我明白了。

segments.en: May I ask what the occasion is?
segments.cn: 请问是什么场合？

segments.en: It's not really an occasion.
segments.cn: 其实没有特别的场合。

segments.en: It's more like I'm sorry.
segments.cn: 更像是我很抱歉。

segments.en: Very well.
segments.cn: 很好。

segments.en: This arrangement here is very popular among regretful husbands and boyfriends.
segments.cn: 这个花束在后悔的丈夫和男朋友中非常受欢迎。

segments.en: It has a dozen long-stemmed red roses with a couple of sunflowers and a single orchid that stands out.
segments.cn: 它有一打长茎红玫瑰，配有几朵向日葵和一朵突出的兰花。

segments.en: It includes a small Teddy bear to achieve the effect of immediate forgiveness.
segments.cn: 还包括一个小泰迪熊，以达到立即原谅的效果。

segments.en: I think I'm going to need more than just a dozen red roses and a bear.
segments.cn: 我想我需要的不仅仅是一打红玫瑰和一只熊。

segments.en: What else do you recommend?
segments.cn: 你还有什么推荐的？

segments.en: Well, this is our I'm sorry I cheated on you package.
segments.cn: 嗯，这是我们的“对不起，我背叛了你”套餐。

segments.en: Two dozen red roses lined with tulips, carnations and lilies.
segments.cn: 两打红玫瑰，配有郁金香、康乃馨和百合。

segments.en: The fragrance and beauty of this flower arrangement is sure to make her forgive you.
segments.cn: 这个花束的香气和美丽一定会让她原谅你。

segments.en: I don't think that's going to cut it.
segments.cn: 我觉得这不够。

segments.en: I need something bigger and better.
segments.cn: 我需要更大更好的。

segments.en: I'm sorry, sir, but what exactly did you do?
segments.cn: 对不起，先生，但你到底做了什么？

segments.en: Well, I may have accidentally insinuated that she is getting chubbier.
segments.cn: 嗯，我可能不小心暗示她变胖了。

segments.en: Get out of my store, you jerk!
segments.cn: 滚出我的店，混蛋！

segments.en: All right, we're back, so what do you think?
segments.cn: 好吧，我们回来了，你觉得怎么样？

segments.en: Is this really like a bad thing to do?
segments.cn: 这真的很糟糕吗？

segments.en: Heck yeah!
segments.cn: 当然是！

segments.en: No, really?
segments.cn: 真的？

segments.en: Well, no one wants to hear that someone thinks they're fat.
segments.cn: 嗯，没有人想听到有人觉得他们胖。

segments.en: Okay, and chubby is maybe not as bad as fat, but the guy could have been a little bit nicer.
segments.cn: 好吧，胖可能比肥胖好，但这个家伙可以稍微好一点。

segments.en: All right, so we'll give our listeners some advice towards the end of the lesson.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们将在课程结束时给听众一些建议。

segments.en: So now, why don't we take a look at all the flower names in Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 现在，我们来看看Language Takeaway中的所有花名。

segments.en: Okay, this first flower is a beautiful one and it has delicious seeds that people like to eat.
segments.cn: 好的，这第一种花很美丽，种子很好吃，人们喜欢吃。

segments.en: It's called a sunflower.
segments.cn: 它叫向日葵。

segments.en: A sunflower.
segments.cn: 向日葵。

segments.en: All right, so that's a yellow flower, right?
segments.cn: 好的，这是一种黄色的花，对吧？

segments.en: It's bright yellow and in the middle is orange and the stems are very, very long.
segments.cn: 它是明亮的黄色，中间是橙色，茎非常非常长。

segments.en: And thick.
segments.cn: 而且很粗。

segments.en: Yeah, and thick, so it's a tall flower.
segments.cn: 是的，而且很粗，所以它是一种高大的花。

segments.en: Okay, sunflower.
segments.cn: 好的，向日葵。

segments.en: And yeah, as you mentioned, some people eat sunflower seeds.
segments.cn: 是的，正如你提到的，有些人吃向日葵种子。

segments.en: They're like the little salty ones.
segments.cn: 它们是那种小咸的。

segments.en: That's right, they're really good.
segments.cn: 没错，它们真的很好。

segments.en: All right, next is an orchid.
segments.cn: 好的，下一个是兰花。

segments.en: Okay, an orchid is a beautiful flower and they're often grown just one at a time.
segments.cn: 好的，兰花是一种美丽的花，通常一次只种一朵。

segments.en: And people collect orchids, so these can be very, very expensive.
segments.cn: 人们收集兰花，所以这些可能非常非常贵。

segments.en: They're very expensive.
segments.cn: 它们非常贵。

segments.en: And they come in all shapes, sizes and colors.
segments.cn: 而且有各种形状、大小和颜色。

segments.en: Okay, an orchid.
segments.cn: 好的，兰花。

segments.en: Now what about a tulip?
segments.cn: 那么郁金香呢？

segments.en: A tulip is another pretty flower and I think they're most famous in Holland for their tulips because this actually used to be the kind of money that they would use.
segments.cn: 郁金香是另一种漂亮的花，我认为它们在荷兰最有名，因为它们的郁金香实际上曾经是他们使用的货币。

segments.en: This was their currency for many years.
segments.cn: 这是他们多年来的货币。

segments.en: They used to use tulips.
segments.cn: 他们曾经使用郁金香。

segments.en: They used to use tulips and the tulip flower is kind of like a... it's like a champagne glass.
segments.cn: 郁金香的花有点像……就像香槟杯。

segments.en: It's tall and it's kind of empty in the middle.
segments.cn: 它高而且中间有点空。

segments.en: Wow, that's interesting.
segments.cn: 哇，这很有趣。

segments.en: So next time somebody says, do you think money grows on trees?
segments.cn: 所以下次有人问，钱是从树上长出来的吗？

segments.en: In Holland, it literally did.
segments.cn: 在荷兰，它确实是。

segments.en: Well, yeah, almost.
segments.cn: 嗯，差不多。

segments.en: All right, what about a carnation?
segments.cn: 好吧，康乃馨呢？

segments.en: Okay, a carnation is another pretty flower and they come, I think, in red, pink and white.
segments.cn: 好的，康乃馨是另一种漂亮的花，我认为它们有红色、粉色和白色。

segments.en: Yeah, I've mostly seen white carnations.
segments.cn: 是的，我大多见过白色康乃馨。

segments.en: Yeah, and you know, flower giving, there's a whole definition to it, right?
segments.cn: 是的，送花有其定义，对吧？

segments.en: So yeah, every flower is symbolic of something.
segments.cn: 所以是的，每种花都有象征意义。

segments.en: Red roses are for love and carnations, I think, are generally for either friendship or like when someone dies, I'm not sure.
segments.cn: 红玫瑰代表爱情，而康乃馨，我认为通常代表友谊或有人去世时，我不太确定。

segments.en: Or you can give them when someone has passed away.
segments.cn: 或者你可以在有人去世时送它们。

segments.en: Really?
segments.cn: 真的？

segments.en: I'm not sure I have to look it up, but carnation is another very, very common flower that you'll see in many different colors.
segments.cn: 我不确定，我得查一下，但康乃馨是另一种非常非常常见的花，你会看到很多不同的颜色。

segments.en: Okay, and the next flower is also really common.
segments.cn: 好的，接下来的花也很常见。

segments.en: It's a Lily.
segments.cn: 是百合。

segments.en: All right, a Lily is a beautiful flower and usually you see these on water, so water lilies, for example, is another name you might hear.
segments.cn: 好的，百合是一种美丽的花，通常你会在水上看到这些，所以水百合，例如，是你可能听到的另一个名字。

segments.en: Okay, a water Lily or just a regular Lily.
segments.cn: 好的，水百合或普通百合。

segments.en: And next we have the most common of all the flowers.
segments.cn: 接下来是所有花中最常见的。

segments.en: But we've added a little twist to it.
segments.cn: 但我们给它加了一点变化。

segments.en: It's a long stem Rose.
segments.cn: 它是长茎玫瑰。

segments.en: Right, so Rose everyone knows.
segments.cn: 对，玫瑰大家都知道。

segments.en: A Rose by any other name would smell as sweet.
segments.cn: 玫瑰无论叫什么名字都一样芬芳。

segments.en: Shakespeare wrote a lot about roses.
segments.cn: 莎士比亚写了很多关于玫瑰的作品。

segments.en: But in this case, we're talking about long stem roses.
segments.cn: 但在这种情况下，我们谈论的是长茎玫瑰。

segments.en: And we talked about this with sunflowers.
segments.cn: 我们和向日葵谈过这个。

segments.en: The stem is the green part that grows out of the ground and you think of the flower as the head.
segments.cn: 茎是从地面长出的绿色部分，你可以把花看作是花头。

segments.en: And so the stem is actually the connector between the ground and the flower.
segments.cn: 所以茎实际上是连接地面和花的部分。

segments.en: Okay, so these types of roses have a really long stem, so they're very nice to like maybe give them give one of them away.
segments.cn: 好的，这些类型的玫瑰有很长的茎，所以它们非常适合送人。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: And you see, for example, at the opera, you see singers, people throw these roses at them and they pick them up and they're so long.
segments.cn: 例如，在歌剧中，你会看到歌手，人们向他们扔这些玫瑰，他们捡起来，茎非常长。

segments.en: The stems are so long and they collect them in their arms.
segments.cn: 茎非常长，他们用手臂收集它们。

segments.en: And so that's a long stem Rose.
segments.cn: 这就是长茎玫瑰。

segments.en: All right, interesting.
segments.cn: 好的，有趣。

segments.en: Okay, why don't we listen to our dialogue for the second time.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们再听一次对话。

segments.en: Let's keep a lookout for these flower names and their pronunciation.
segments.cn: 让我们留意这些花的名称和发音。

segments.en: And we'll come back in a little bit.
segments.cn: 我们稍后再回来。

segments.en: Hello, sir, how may I help you?
segments.cn: 你好，先生，我能帮您什么？

segments.en: I would like to buy some flowers, please.
segments.cn: 我想买一些花。

segments.en: Something really nice.
segments.cn: 一些非常好的花。

segments.en: I see.
segments.cn: 我明白了。

segments.en: May I ask what the occasion is?
segments.cn: 请问是什么场合？

segments.en: It's not really an occasion.
segments.cn: 其实没有什么特别的场合。

segments.en: It's more like I'm sorry.
segments.cn: 更像是我很抱歉。

segments.en: Very well.
segments.cn: 很好。

segments.en: This arrangement here is very popular among regretful husbands and boyfriends.
segments.cn: 这个花束在后悔的丈夫和男朋友中非常受欢迎。

segments.en: It has a dozen long stem red roses with a couple of sunflowers and a single orchid that stands out.
segments.cn: 它有一打长茎红玫瑰，几朵向日葵和一朵突出的兰花。

segments.en: Includes a small Teddy bear to achieve the effect of immediate forgiveness.
segments.cn: 包括一个小泰迪熊，以达到立即原谅的效果。

segments.en: I think I'm going to need more than just a dozen red roses and a bear.
segments.cn: 我想我需要的不仅仅是一打红玫瑰和一只熊。

segments.en: What else do you recommend?
segments.cn: 你还有什么推荐？

segments.en: Well, this is our I'm sorry I cheated on you package.
segments.cn: 嗯，这是我们的“对不起，我背叛了你”套餐。

segments.en: Two dozen red roses lined with tulips, carnations and lilies.
segments.cn: 两打红玫瑰，搭配郁金香、康乃馨和百合。

segments.en: The fragrance and beauty of this flower arrangement is sure to make her forgive you.
segments.cn: 这个花束的香气和美丽一定会让她原谅你。

segments.en: I don't think that's going to cut it.
segments.cn: 我觉得这还不够。

segments.en: I need something bigger and better.
segments.cn: 我需要更大更好的。

segments.en: I'm sorry, sir, but what exactly did you do?
segments.cn: 对不起，先生，但你到底做了什么？

segments.en: Well, I may have accidentally insinuated that she is getting chubbier.
segments.cn: 嗯，我可能不小心暗示她变得更胖了。

segments.en: Get out of my store, you jerk.
segments.cn: 滚出我的店，混蛋。

segments.en: All right, we're back.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们回来了。

segments.en: So in this dialogue, we had a lot of interesting phrases.
segments.cn: 在这段对话中，我们有很多有趣的短语。

segments.en: So let's look at them now in Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 现在让我们在流利度构建器中看看它们。

segments.en: A lot of these phrases, Marco, have to do with, well, what the guy did wrong in today's dialogue.
segments.cn: 这些短语，Marco，很多都与今天对话中这个家伙做错的事有关。

segments.en: And so the first one is to cheat on.
segments.cn: 第一个是背叛。

segments.en: So the woman offered him the I'm sorry I cheated on you package, right?
segments.cn: 所以女人给了他“对不起，我背叛了你”的套餐，对吧？

segments.en: So it's like an arrangement of flowers that usually people buy when they cheated on their boyfriend or girlfriend.
segments.cn: 这就像是人们在背叛男朋友或女朋友时通常会买的花束。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: And so in this case, to cheat on means to see another person.
segments.cn: 在这种情况下，背叛意味着与其他人交往。

segments.en: So if you're married to a woman, seeing someone else, you know, having a date or romantic encounter with another person is cheating on your wife.
segments.cn: 如果你已婚，和其他人约会或有浪漫接触就是在背叛你的妻子。

segments.en: So you're cheating on your wife, right?
segments.cn: 所以你在背叛你的妻子，对吧？

segments.en: You use it like this cheat on, right?
segments.cn: 你这样用背叛，对吧？

segments.en: Cheat on.
segments.cn: 背叛。

segments.en: So he cheated on her or they were both cheating on each other.
segments.cn: 所以他背叛了她，或者他们彼此都在背叛。

segments.en: Okay, so to cheat on, not a good thing.
segments.cn: 好吧，背叛，不是好事。

segments.en: Not a good thing.
segments.cn: 不是好事。

segments.en: All right, so he was explaining to her that wasn't enough, the arrangement wasn't enough.
segments.cn: 好吧，他在向她解释说，这个花束不够。

segments.en: And he said, I don't think that's gonna cut it.
segments.cn: 他说，我觉得这还不够。

segments.en: Well, okay, you've probably heard the word cut before.
segments.cn: 好吧，你可能听过“切”的这个词。

segments.en: But in this case, Marco, we're talking about to be able to cut something, to cut it.
segments.cn: 但在这种情况下，Marco，我们说的是能够切东西，切它。

segments.en: So that's not gonna cut it or it's not gonna cut it.
segments.cn: 所以这不够，或者说这不够。

segments.en: It's not gonna be enough.
segments.cn: 这不够。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: So that's not quite what I'm looking for.
segments.cn: 所以这不是我想要的。

segments.en: It's not enough.
segments.cn: 不够。

segments.en: He wants bigger and better.
segments.cn: 他想要更大更好。

segments.en: He wants more.
segments.cn: 他想要更多。

segments.en: And so, for example, we could say, you know what, this dessert's not gonna cut it.
segments.cn: 例如，我们可以说，你知道吗，这个甜点不够好。

segments.en: We need something much fancier.
segments.cn: 我们需要更华丽的东西。

segments.en: Okay, so... To be good enough for.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以……足够好。

segments.en: Okay, so to be good enough for.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以足够好。

segments.en: All right, very good.
segments.cn: 好的，非常好。

segments.en: And then he was explaining to the shop lady what happened.
segments.cn: 然后他在向店员解释发生了什么。

segments.en: And he said, well, I accidentally insinuated.
segments.cn: 他说，嗯，我不小心暗示了。

segments.en: Okay, to insinuate is to suggest.
segments.cn: 好吧，暗示就是建议。

segments.en: So I could say, hey, you're really chubby.
segments.cn: 所以我可以说，嘿，你真的很胖。

segments.en: That's not an insinuation.
segments.cn: 那不是暗示。

segments.en: That's a statement.
segments.cn: 那是一个陈述。

segments.en: But I could say, well, you're looking a little bit round at the sides.
segments.cn: 但我可以说，嗯，你的侧面看起来有点圆。

segments.en: That's an insinuation because I'm suggesting without saying something.
segments.cn: 那是一个暗示，因为我在不直接说的情况下建议。

segments.en: Right, so you're saying something indirectly, right?
segments.cn: 对，所以你是间接地说了什么，对吧？

segments.en: And he was insinuating that his girlfriend was getting chubbier.
segments.cn: 他在暗示他的女朋友变得更胖了。

segments.en: Chubby.
segments.cn: 胖。

segments.en: So chubby, chubbier, chubbiest.
segments.cn: 所以胖，变胖，最胖。

segments.en: In this case, we're talking about being round or a little bit overweight.
segments.cn: 在这种情况下，我们说的是有点圆或稍微超重。

segments.en: Right, so it's not really saying fat.
segments.cn: 对，所以这并不是说胖。

segments.en: No, fat is rude.
segments.cn: 不，胖是粗鲁的。

segments.en: Chubby is, you know, it's in between.
segments.cn: 胖是，你知道的，介于两者之间。

segments.en: Just a little bit extra pounds.
segments.cn: 只是多了几磅。

segments.en: Yeah, like, maybe you had a little bit too much ice cream over the past couple months.
segments.cn: 是的，可能是你在过去几个月里吃了太多冰淇淋。

segments.en: All right, very good.
segments.cn: 好的，非常好。

segments.en: So why don't we listen to the dialogue for the last time and we'll be back.
segments.cn: 那么我们再听一次对话，然后再回来。

segments.en: Hello, sir.
segments.cn: 你好，先生。

segments.en: How may I help you?
segments.cn: 我能帮您什么？

segments.en: I would like to buy some flowers, please.
segments.cn: 我想买一些花。

segments.en: Something really nice.
segments.cn: 一些非常好的花。

segments.en: I see.
segments.cn: 我明白了。

segments.en: May I ask what the occasion is?
segments.cn: 请问是什么场合？

segments.en: It's not really an occasion.
segments.cn: 其实没有什么特别的场合。

segments.en: It's more like I'm sorry.
segments.cn: 更像是我很抱歉。

segments.en: Very well.
segments.cn: 很好。

segments.en: This arrangement here is very popular among regretful husbands and boyfriends.
segments.cn: 这个花束在后悔的丈夫和男朋友中非常受欢迎。

segments.en: It has a dozen long stem red roses with a couple of sunflowers and a single orchid that stands out.
segments.cn: 它有一打长茎红玫瑰，几朵向日葵和一朵突出的兰花。

segments.en: Includes a small Teddy bear to achieve the effect of immediate forgiveness.
segments.cn: 包括一个小泰迪熊，以达到立即原谅的效果。

segments.en: I think I'm gonna need more than just a dozen red roses and a bear.
segments.cn: 我想我需要的不仅仅是一打红玫瑰和一只熊。

segments.en: What else do you recommend?
segments.cn: 你还有什么推荐？

segments.en: Well, this is our I'm sorry I cheated on you package.
segments.cn: 嗯，这是我们的“对不起，我背叛了你”套餐。

segments.en: Two dozen red roses lined with tulips, carnations and lilies.
segments.cn: 两打红玫瑰，搭配郁金香、康乃馨和百合。

segments.en: The fragrance and beauty of this flower arrangement is sure to make her forgive you.
segments.cn: 这个花束的香气和美丽一定会让她原谅你。

segments.en: I don't think that's gonna cut it.
segments.cn: 我觉得这还不够。

segments.en: I need something bigger and better.
segments.cn: 我需要更大更好的东西。

segments.en: I'm sorry, sir, but what exactly did you do?
segments.cn: 对不起，先生，但你到底做了什么？

segments.en: Well, I may have accidentally insinuated that she is getting chubbier.
segments.cn: 嗯，我可能不小心暗示她变得更胖了。

segments.en: Get out of my store, you jerk!
segments.cn: 滚出我的店，混蛋！

segments.en: All right, so if you make a mistake, like as a guy, right?
segments.cn: 好吧，如果你犯了错误，比如作为一个男人，对吧？

segments.en: You give flowers to your girlfriend.
segments.cn: 你给女朋友送花。

segments.en: What about women giving flowers to guys?
segments.cn: 那女人给男人送花呢？

segments.en: Is that common?
segments.cn: 这常见吗？

segments.en: Do you think that's possible?
segments.cn: 你觉得可能吗？

segments.en: Can you do that?
segments.cn: 你能做到吗？

segments.en: I'm sure you can do it, but I don't know if it's as common.
segments.cn: 我相信你可以做到，但我不知道这是否常见。

segments.en: Um, like I think as a guy, I wouldn't really feel comfortable receiving flowers.
segments.cn: 嗯，我觉得作为一个男人，我不太会觉得收花舒服。

segments.en: Really?
segments.cn: 真的？

segments.en: I mean, I would be touched by the gesture and I would be like, oh, that's really sweet.
segments.cn: 我的意思是，我会被这个举动感动，会觉得，哦，这真的很甜。

segments.en: But like flowers, it's a little bit too feminine, I think.
segments.cn: 但花，我觉得有点太女性化了。

segments.en: Generally, I think it's a one-sided thing.
segments.cn: 一般来说，我觉得这是单方面的事情。

segments.en: So you can get flowers for your mother or you can get flowers for a friend.
segments.cn: 所以你可以给母亲送花，或者给朋友送花。

segments.en: Or if someone, you know, passed away, you can get flowers for their family.
segments.cn: 或者如果有人去世了，你可以给他们的家人送花。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: But in a romantic situation, rarely do you get flowers to a guy.
segments.cn: 但在浪漫的情况下，给男人送花的情况很少。

segments.en: So if you want to say I'm sorry to a guy, what do you give him?
segments.cn: 所以如果你想对一个男人说对不起，你给他什么？

segments.en: Um, season tickets to his favorite football.
segments.cn: 嗯，给他最喜欢的足球赛季票。

segments.en: That works.
segments.cn: 这可以。

segments.en: Or a game for his PlayStation or offer him a new coat of paint on his car.
segments.cn: 或者给他的PlayStation游戏，或者给他的车重新喷漆。

segments.en: I don't know.
segments.cn: 我不知道。

segments.en: Have you never given a gift to somebody like saying I'm sorry?
segments.cn: 你从来没有给别人送过礼物说对不起吗？

segments.en: No.
segments.cn: 没有。

segments.en: No, you don't make mistakes.
segments.cn: 不，你不犯错误。

segments.en: I like to use my words.
segments.cn: 我喜欢用我的话。

segments.en: Ah, that's good.
segments.cn: 啊，那很好。

segments.en: Yeah, this is kind of interesting.
segments.cn: 是的，这有点有趣。

segments.en: Why do we do this though?
segments.cn: 但我们为什么要这样做呢？

segments.en: Why do we give gifts to people as a token or as a demonstration of our regretfulness?
segments.cn: 我们为什么要给人送礼物作为我们懊悔的象征或表现？

segments.en: Well, can I get personal for a second?
segments.cn: 嗯，我可以私下问一下吗？

segments.en: I just was thinking about this in terms of engagement.
segments.cn: 我刚刚在想这个关于订婚的事情。

segments.en: So why do people give a ring when they get engaged?
segments.cn: 那么人们为什么在订婚时给戒指呢？

segments.en: I think it's because people like things that glitter.
segments.cn: 我觉得是因为人们喜欢闪闪发光的东西。

segments.en: You know, it's like distract the woman and she'll say yes.
segments.cn: 你知道，就像分散女人的注意力，她就会答应。

segments.en: And so it's the similar thing with flowers and forgiveness.
segments.cn: 所以花和原谅也是类似的事情。

segments.en: You say, oh gosh, these flowers are so beautiful.
segments.cn: 你说，哦，天哪，这些花真美。

segments.en: Oh, of course I forgive you.
segments.cn: 哦，当然我原谅你。

segments.en: They're so pretty and they smell so... You know, it's like distraction from the matter at hand.
segments.cn: 它们太漂亮了，闻起来也... 你知道，这就像是对眼前问题的分散注意力。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: Maybe that's it.
segments.cn: 也许就是这样。

segments.en: I don't know.
segments.cn: 我不知道。

segments.en: If you disagree with me, please.
segments.cn: 如果你不同意我，请。

segments.en: It was a very wise man who invented this.
segments.cn: 发明这个的真是个聪明人。

segments.en: Absolutely.
segments.cn: 绝对是。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: So if you have any questions, doubts or comments, please come to our website EnglishPod.com and we'll see you guys there.
segments.cn: 所以如果你有任何问题、疑虑或评论，请访问我们的网站 EnglishPod.com，我们在那里见。

segments.en: Bye everyone.
segments.cn: 大家再见。

segments.en: Bye.
segments.cn: 再见。
